member.name: WAVEFORMAT
member.summary: The WAVEFORMAT structure describes the format of waveform-audio data. Only format information common to all waveform-audio data formats is included in this structure. This structure has been superseded by the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

summary.para: Format type. The following type is defined:

member.name: WAVEFORMAT.nChannels
member.summary: Number of channels in the waveform-audio data. Mono data uses one channel and stereo data uses two channels.

member.name: WAVEFORMAT.nSamplesPerSec
member.summary: Sample rate, in samples per second.

member.name: WAVEFORMAT.nAvgBytesPerSec
member.summary: Required average data transfer rate, in bytes per second. For example, 16-bit stereo at 44.1 kHz has an average data rate of 176,400 bytes per second (2 channels — 2 bytes per sample per channel — 44,100 samples per second).

member.name: WAVEFORMAT.nBlockAlign
member.summary: Block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data. For PCM data, the block alignment is the number of bytes used by a single sample, including data for both channels if the data is stereo. For example, the block alignment for 16-bit stereo PCM is 4 bytes (2 channels — 2 bytes per sample).
